com.rivieracode.realm

Class Realm

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sun.enterprise.security.auth.realm.Realm
      • com.sun.appserv.security.AppservRealm
        • com.rivieracode.realm.Realm
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Comparable

    public class Realm
extends com.sun.appserv.security.AppservRealm
    Configures the application server to delegate authentication and authorization to the local EJB.

    Realm and LoginModule classes are linked in the container configuration (login.conf for Glassfish) : 

     RivieraRealmContext {
   com.rivieracode.realm.LoginModule required;<
 };

    Custom realm is configured in Glassfish in Configurations : Server-Config : Security : Realms : "MyRealm"

    Class name must implement as class com.rivieracode.realm.Realm and the property LOCAL_BEAN_JNDI with the JNDI path of the local bean delegated for the authentication.

    Author:
    Jean-Michel Tanguy

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String JAAS_CONTEXT_PROPERTY
      JAAS_CONTEXT : property used in the login.conf to link the LoginModule and the realm (default : RivieraRealmContext)
      static String LOCAL_BEAN_JNDI_PROPERTY
      LOCAL_BEAN_JNDI : name space of the delegated local bean implementing RealmDelegate (default : java:global/RiveraRealmDB/DelegatedBean)
      static String REALM_NAME_PROPERTY
      REALM_NAME : name and description of the type of authentication supported (default : RiveraRealm)

      • getJAASContext

        public String getJAASContext()
        JAAS Context used to link the LoginModule and the Realm in the container configuration. Set by the JAAS_CONTEXT_PROPERTY and the declaration in the login.conf file in Glassfish configuration directory:

        RivieraRealmContext { com.rivieracode.realm.LoginModule required;< };

        Overrides:
        getJAASContext in class com.sun.enterprise.security.auth.realm.Realm
        Returns:
        JAAS Context name

        Throws:
        com.sun.enterprise.security.auth.realm.InvalidOperationException - if any error occurs
